title: ESRC The Future of the UK and Scotland Co-ordinator Post-Invitation Only
abstractText:
The role of the Coordinator of the Future of the UK and Scotland Programme is to build connections between a range of projects ESRC has supported to explore issues around the Scottish referendum on independence in 2014.These include a number of research fellowships, grants that build on the work of existing ESRC research centres, an extension to the British Election Study, and a new research centre, the Scottish Centre for Constititional Change.The aim is twofold:

  1. to engage ESRC-funded research to help inform the debate about Scottish independence and its implications for Scotland and the rest of the UK. The Coordinator will build opportunities for researchers to engage with relevant stakeholders and to communicate findings in accessible ways which help inform voter decisions in 2014
  2. to explore the referendum as a fundamental issue for social science analysis. It is rare that citizens are faced with such a fundamental choice as whether or not to create a new states.This creates opportunities for ESRC-funded researchers to understand the character and resilience of social relationships amid the pressures created by that choice.The Coordinator will work across the various projects to ensure this opportunity is taken.
